text.value: Name of Department/Section/Unit:
SECTION 1: PERSONAL INFORMATION
1. Position of Key Informant
Health Management Information System Officer
Disease Surveillance Officer
Emergency Operation Centre Manager
Other
SECTION 1: PERSONAL INFORMATION
Other position of Key informant
2. How long have you been in your current position? Years
Years
In months
3. What is your professional background: mention
4. What is your highest level of education?
Undergraduate degree
Master’s degree
PhD
Other
SECTION 1: PERSONAL INFORMATION
Other Highest Education Level
5. Sex
Male
Female
6. What is your current age in years

SECTION 2: HEALTH DATA ATTRIBUTES: 7. Data sources: On the scale shown; Which of the following of are the major sources of health data for your routine data and how frequently are used? (Frequently (2), Rarely (1), Never (0))
i. Routine weekly reports of health care services from health facilities
ii. Routine monthly reports of health care services from health facilities
iii. Administrative record of district offices
iv. Vertical program
v. Demographic and health surveys
vi. Other surveillance systems data
vii. Outbreaks/epidemics line list
viii. Research and higher learning institutions
ix. Registration, Insolvency and Trusteeship Agency (RITA)
x. Social media
vii. Other (Specify)
in the following format: Data source1 (Rate), Data source2 (Rate), ...

8. Data accessibility and timelines: On the scale shown, kindly indicate how you agree with the statements regarding your accessibility to data ( Strongly agree (5), Agree slightly (4), Neither agree nor disagree (3), Disagree slightly (2), Disagree strongly (1) )
i. You easily and conveniently access data that you need to make an evidence-based decision
ii. It takes a lot of time to find the required data to make timely decisions
iii. Data is stored in a way that is difficult for you to access
iv. You do not have the capacity to manipulate the DHIS2 to generate data reports
v. Reporting from the lower levels of health system is always on time (according to the set national reporting timelines)
vi. Data is always available on time for decision making
9. Data storage: Where do you currently keep/store health related data? (Always (2), Rarely (1), No (0))
i. Data is kept in paper report forms
ii. Data is kept in a computer
iii. Data is kept in the server
iv. Other
in format: Storage1 (Rate). eg Laptop (1)
v. Active system for data backup and archiving present

10. Data accuracy: Please rate your performance on the stated data accuracy domains ( Strongly agree (5), Agree slightly (4), Neither agree nor disagree (3), Disagree slightly (2), Disagree strongly (1) )
i. You frequently encounter inaccurate data
ii. Inaccurate data has hindered you from routinely using data to make decisions
iii. You normally take corrective action to address noted data accuracy issues before use
iv. You normally rely on/use other data sources and not only routine health data to make decisions

11. Data quality: Please rate the quality of the following data completeness domains ( Strongly agree (5), Agree slightly (4), Neither agree nor disagree (3), Disagree slightly (2), Disagree strongly (1) )
i. The data that you receive includes all the necessary dataset reports
ii. The data that you receive is sufficiently complete and detailed for your needs
iii. The data that you receive is relevant to your current data analysis and aggregation needs
iv. There is limited value due to aggregating inconsistent data
12. Data producers/users interaction: Please, rate your frequency of interactions with data producers on specific activities (Always (2), Rarely (1), Never (0))
i. What is your frequency of interaction (working together) with data producers (your data sources)?
ii. As the data user; do you carry out a joint data analysis and interpretation with data producers?
iii. As the data user; do you carry out a joint discussion regarding data quality with data producers?
iv. As the data user; do you provide feedback to data producers regarding the quality of data?

SECTION 3: DATA ANALYSIS: 13. Data analysis capability: Please rate your capability to conduct the following data analysis activities (Excellent (5), Above average (4), Average (3), Below average (2), Poor (1))
i. Technical skill in data capture and organization
ii. Data analysis
iii. Calculation of percentages, frequency or rates correctly
iv. Plotting data by weeks, months or years or by areas
v. Plotting data into bar charts
vi. Maps production
vii. Technical skills on data presentation and interpretation
viii. Technical skills on report writing
ix. Technical skills on information dissemination
x. Motivation and interests related to data management cycle

14. Analysis processes: Please rate the processes related to conduct of data analysis ( Strongly agree (5), Agree slightly (4), Neither agree nor disagree (3), Disagree slightly (2), Disagree strongly (1) )
i. Dashboard/system contains sufficient and readily available analysed data to download and utilize (e.g. charts, tables)?
ii. Electronic system allow generation of sufficient and relevant analysed data to download and utilize?
iii. Analyses generated by the dashboard/system contain sufficient information to monitor trends and patterns

iv. Analyses generated by the dashboard/system is sufficient and sensitive for Early Warning Alert and Response System (EWAR), e.g. provide immediate alerts/notifications to users on unusual trends or exceeded thresholds
v. Additional analyses needed to complement automated results from dashboard/system
vi. Additional analyses needed to conduct comparison analyses (over time, between facilities, between indicators performance)
vii. Ability to export data for custom analysis
viii. Who, What, Where (3W) matrix
15. Please, mention the specific programme/software that is used for data analysis
16. Please, mention the specific programme/software that is used for maps production
17. How do you currently analyse data? (Frequently (2), Occasionally (1), Never (0))
i. Data is analysed manually
ii. Data is analysed using computer

18. Data use: On the scale shown, how much do you agree or disagree with the following statement regarding your practices on data use in planning, monitoring, evaluation and decision making in the following categories. You use data (Always (2), Rarely (1), Never (0))
i. For day-to-day program management
ii. To make decisions
iii. To assess health facility performance
iv. To evaluate staff performance
v. To monitor pattern and trend of health problems including diseases
vi. For planning, supervision and health promotion
vii. For interventions
viii. For medical supply and drug management
ix. For developing plans
x. For set targets and goals
xi. For budget preparation
xii. For guide budget reallocation
xiii. For human resources management
xiv. To monitor key objectives, policy implementation and performance at different levels of health system
xv. To identify emerging epidemics
xvi. Influence decision markers
xvii. To inform policy development/modification/change
xvii. To inform best practices in health care delivery
Other specify
in format: Data Usage (Rate)

19. Data use in planning, monitoring, evaluation and decisions making is most important in which levels of health system (Strongly agree (5), Agree slightly (4), Neither agree nor disagree (3), Disagree slightly (2), Disagree strongly (1))
i. Community
ii. Primary health facility
iii. District
iv. Regional
v. National
20. Kindly indicate how often the following happen (Daily (5), Weekly (4), Monthly (3), Quarterly (2), Annually (1), Never (0)
i. How often do you have meetings for reviewing managerial or administrative matters?
ii. How often do you provide your staff with continuous professional training related to data management cycle
iii. How often do you send feedback regarding data analysis outputs to community
iv. How often do you send feedback regarding data analysis outputs to district
21. How often the following issues related to health data are discussed in the meetings (Always (2), Rarely (1), Never (0))
i. Data sources
ii. Data quality
iii. Data analysis and presentation
iv. Findings from data analysis and interpretation
v. Data users
vi. Data dissemination/sharing
vii. Data use in decision making
viii. Data use in planning
ix. Feedback from data users
x. Others, specify and rank
22. Do you have any of the following documents related to health data management? Please rate their usefulness to you as: Very useful (3), Somewhat (2), Not useful (1), Don’t have (0)
i. Data analysis and use plan/guidelines
ii. Monthly/annual plan targets
iii. Health-related newsletter
iv. Data sharing policy
v. Reports showing trend/pattern of data use and challenges
vi. Monitoring and evaluation plan of data management cycle
Others, specify and rank
23. If data analysis and use plan/guidelines exist; what would you comment on their usefulness
probe on the frequency of use and associated challenges including training, the complexity of the plan/guidelines, language e.t.c

24. Please indicate how you agree or disagree with the following statements. The introduction of computerized health management information system has strengthened: (Strongly agree (5), Agree slightly (4), Neither agree nor disagree (3), Disagree slightly (2), Disagree strongly (1))
i. Data capture
ii. Data storage
iii. Quality assessment
iv. Data analysis
v. Data presentation
vi. Data use
vii. Reporting
viii. Data sharing
SECTION 5: OBSERVATION CHECKLIST
i. National Guidelines for Integrated Disease Surveillance and Response
Leave 0 if not available and write remarks if available
ii. National Health Information Systems Policy Guidelines
Leave 0 if not available and write remarks if available
iii. Outbreak Thresholds Documents at the health facility
Leave 0 if not available and write remarks if available
iv. Records of received weekly summary reports from districts/councils (during the past 3 months)
Leave 0 if not available and write remarks if available
v. Records of the received monthly summary report from districts/councils (during the past 3 months)
Leave 0 if not available and write remarks if available
vi. Examine the use of data (including trends) toward developing objectives in the health plan
Leave 0 if not available and write remarks if available
vii. Look for evidence of graphs or tables for case trends, geographical distribution, rates, case fatality rates they have developed
Leave 0 if not available and write remarks if available
viii. Look for evidence that data has spurred the national level (Ministry of Health) to take actions in respect to district reports
Leave 0 if not available and write remarks if available
